title: Azmi Nassar
text:
Azmi Nassar (, ; 3 October 1957 – 26 March 2007) was a <a href="Palestinian%20people">Palestinian</a> <a href="association%20football">football</a> <a href="coach%20%28sport%29">manager</a> and served as manager of the <a href="Palestine%20national%20football%20team">Palestinian national football team</a>.
Professional career.
Palestinian National Team.
In order to serve as manager of the <a href="Palestine%20national%20football%20team">Palestinian national football team</a>, Nassar was required to obtain a Palestinian ID and passport to go. His ability to travel freely between the territories contributed to his success as national team coach.
Maccabi Ahi Nazareth.
After guiding the club to the <a href="Israeli%20Premier%20League">Israeli Premier League</a>, Nassar resigned after the club was unsuccessful throughout the season and was replaced by <a href="Yehoshua%20Feigenbaum">Shiye Feigenbaum</a>.
Personal life.
A resident of <a href="Nazareth">Nazareth</a>, Nassar was married to Ruthy, and they are followers of <a href="Christianity">Christianity</a>. Azmi's wife is technically <a href="Judaism">Jewish</a> and until her marriage to Azmi, when she was 18. Ruthy is the daughter of a mixed marriage between Ya'akov Kashlawi (an <a href="Arab%20Christian">Arab Christian</a> from <a href="Bir%20Zeit">Bir Zeit</a>) and Rachel Cohen (a Jew from Petah Tikva).
